page.title: 02BILLERICAY NW Farming Types
page.content: { MOUNTNESSING HALL FARM.}Type of farm. The farm is typical of the area; mainly{arable,}but with some {livestock}_a herd of about 200. They are used for milk and beef, the former are Friesians, the latter being a cross between Friesians and Herefords. Half the herd would be calves, the other half remained until 2\ years old. The soil is heavy, mainly London clay. Drainage pipes have been laid over an extensive area at a depth of 3'. The greatest hazard the farm faces is the climate. {Machinery The farm owns its machinery, having some six tractors of varying power. The heaviest is needed to deal with the clay soil. Lighter ones are used for sowing. There is an irrigation machine, and tankers (diesel) which are sent to refuel the tractors.
